items: Prime Minister Narendra Modi to hold talks with his Bangladesh counterpart Sheikh Hasina in New Delhi today; Two countries to sign a number of agreements.

Centre brings into force stringent law to curb irregularities in competitive examinations. National Testing Agency postpones Joint CSIR-UGC-NET Examination June 2024 due to unavoidable circumstances and logistic issues.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to chair 53rd GST Council meeting in New Delhi today.
Akashvani News recognized as one of most trusted news brands in India.
In cricket, India to take on Bangladesh in Super 8 encounter in T20 Men's World Cup this evening.

items.name: Abraham Lincoln
items.quote: “The best way to predict the future is to create it.”

items.meaning: A polemic is a strong written or spoken attack against someone else’s opinions, beliefs, practices, etc.
items.example: Her book is a fierce polemic against societal inequalities.

items.joke:
I couldn't figure out why the baseball kept getting larger.

Then it hit me.

items.event: Rajarshi Shahu Chhatrapati, great revolutionary freedom fighter and social reformer, was born.
Narayan Shripad Rajhans (Balgandharv), famous singer and actor, was born.
Ghanshyam Das Birla, great freedom fighter and social reformer, was born at Pilani.
M.P. Sivagnanam, famous Tamil writer and social worker, was born at Madras.
Nehru, Chou En-lai pledge good-neighbor policy at New Delhi.
Chaudhary Charan Singh, freedom fighter and Chief Minister of UP, arrested by Government.
First Boeing 707 of Air India `Gaurishankar' was crashed at Sahar Airport (Bombay).
Five hundred killed or missing as monsoon floods hit the Indian state of Gujarat.
Sharad Pawar joins Union Cabinet as Defence Minister.
The Tin Bigha corridor leased to Bangladesh as per the Indo-Bangladesh agreement.
Madhya Pradesh declared 'Tiger State' as it homes one sixth of the world's tiger population.
India declares its chemical weapon stockpiles and storage facilities as part of its obligations as signatory to the Chemical Weapons Convention.
